iti96:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti96:2.1: “Mendicants, one attached to both sensual pleasures and rebirth is a returner, who comes back to this state of existence.
iti96:2.2: One detached from sensual pleasures but still attached to rebirth is a non-returner, who comes not back to this state of existence.
iti96:2.3: One detached from both sensual pleasures and rebirth is a perfected one, who has ended defilements.”
iti96:2.4: That is what the Buddha said.
iti96:3.2: and the desire to be reborn in a future life;
iti96:4.1: Those who’ve given up sensual pleasures
iti96:4.2: without attaining the end of defilements,
iti96:4.3: and are still attached to being reborn,
iti96:5.1: Those who have cut off doubt,
iti96:5.2: and ended conceit and future lives,
iti96:5.3: they’re the ones in this world who’ve truly crossed over,
iti96:5.4: having reached the ending of defilements.”
iti96:6.1: This too was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
